verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David the servant of Jehovah. The transgression <WH6588> of the wicked <WH7563> saith <WH5002> within <WH7130> my heart <WH3820>, There is no fear <WH6343> of God <WH430> before his eyes <WH5869>.
For he flattereth <WH2505> himself in his own eyes <WH5869>, That his iniquity <WH5771> will not be found <WH4672> out and be hated <WH8130>.
The words <WH1697> of his mouth <WH6310> are iniquity <WH205> and deceit <WH4820>: He hath ceased <WH2308> to be wise <WH7919> and to do good <WH3190>.
He deviseth <WH2803> iniquity <WH205> upon his bed <WH4904>; He setteth <WH3320> himself in a way <WH1870> that is not good <WH2896>; He abhorreth <WH3988> not evil <WH7451>.
Thy lovingkindness <WH2617>, O Jehovah <WH3068>, is in the heavens <WH8064>; Thy faithfulness <WH530> reacheth unto the skies <WH7834>.

Thy righteousness <WH6666> is like the mountains <WH2042> of God <WH410>; Thy judgments <WH4941> are a great <WH7227> deep <WH8415>: O Jehovah <WH3068>, thou preservest <WH3467> man <WH120> and beast <WH929>.
How precious <WH3368> is thy lovingkindness <WH2617>, O God <WH430>! And the children <WH1121> of men <WH120> take refuge <WH2620> under the shadow <WH6738> of thy wings <WH3671>.
They shall be abundantly satisfied <WH7301> with the fatness <WH1880> of thy house <WH1004>; And thou wilt make them drink <WH8248> of the river <WH5158> of thy pleasures <WH5730>.
For with thee is the fountain <WH4726> of life <WH2416>: In thy light <WH216> shall we see <WH7200> light <WH216>.
Oh continue <WH4900> thy lovingkindness <WH2617> unto them that know <WH3045> thee <WH6666>, And thy righteousness to the upright <WH3477> in heart <WH3820>.
Let not the foot <WH7272> of pride <WH1346> come <WH935> against me <WH3027>, And let not the hand of the wicked <WH7563> drive me away <WH5110>.
There are the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205> fallen <WH5307>: They are thrust down <WH1760>, and shall not be able <WH3201> to rise <WH6965>.
